author: hwright
msg: In an effort to win the Developer of the Month award for May, I continue
my endless churn of the wcprops upgrading code.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/upgrade.c
(convert_wcprops): Actually use the prop_path variable introduced in

author: hwright
msg: * subversion/libsvn_wc/upgrade.c
(convert_wcprops):  Read the wcprops from the correct file, and also
avoid reconstructing a path we already have.

author: hwright
msg: Fix a test error introduced by r37682, wherein a new variable assignment
clobbered a value we were actually interested in.  To fix, do the interesting
assignment a litte later.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/upgrade.c
(convert_wcprops): Lazily set the output proplist value.

author: hwright
msg: When upgrading single-file wcprops, properly calculate the corresponding
path by stripping the .svn/wcprops from the wcprops path.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/upgrade.c
(convert_wcprops): Do some crazy path manipulations to accomplish the above.

author: hwright
msg: Don't clobber existent wcprops in the wc.db when upgrading.  We could get
into this situation if an f12 wc with optional wcprops in the working copy
gets touched with an older f12 client.  In this case, just ignore the wcprops
in the file, and use what's in the db.
* subversion/libsvn_wc/upgrade.c
(convert_wcprops): Don't set the dav cache if stuff in it already exists.
